title: Focaccia
summary: Focaccia (/fəˈkætʃə, fʌ-, foʊ-/; Italian pronunciation: [foˈkatt͡ʃa]; Ligurian: fugassa [fyˈɡasa]) is a flat leavened oven-baked Italian bread,[1] similar in style and texture to pizza; in some places, it is called "pizza bianca" (“white pizza”).[2][3][4] Focaccia can be served as a side dish or as sandwich bread.
